Package etomica.data

Class DataAccumulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.data.DataProcessor
      • etomica.data.DataProcessorForked
        • etomica.data.DataAccumulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataPipe, DataPipeForked, IDataSink, IDataSource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccumulatorAutocorrelationPTensor, AccumulatorAverage, AccumulatorAverageBlockless, AccumulatorAverageBlocklessSlim, AccumulatorAverageBootstrap, AccumulatorAverageCollapsingLog, AccumulatorCounter, AccumulatorHistogram, AccumulatorHistory

    public abstract class DataAccumulator
extends DataProcessorForked
implements IDataSource
    DataProcessor that accumulates and transforms given data and intermittently transmits processed data to other DataSink(s). As a DataSink in a data stream, this instance will take data given to it and perform some action using it (for example, accumulating an average or other statistics, updating a histogram). After a specified number of times, this instance will push the accumulated data to DataSink(s) that have been added to it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataAccumulator

        public DataAccumulator​()
        Constructs accumulator with no initial DataSink. The default pushInterval is 1 and isActive() is true.

    • Method Detail

      • addData

        protected abstract boolean addData​(IData data)
        Defined by subclass to specify what this accumulator does when data is added to it.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be processed
        Returns:
        true if the Accumulator's getData method will now return different data.

      • reset

        public abstract void reset​()
        Clear accumulated values.

      • getData

        public abstract IData getData​()
        Specified by:
        getData in interface IDataSource
        Returns:
        the data given by this source

      • processData

        protected IData processData​(IData inputData)
        Returns getData() every pushInterval times it is invoked, otherwise returns null (thereby preventing transmission of data to the next DataSinks). If isActive is false, data is not accumulated and no action is performed.
        Specified by:
        processData in class DataProcessor
        Parameters:
        inputData - data to be processed.
        Returns:
        processed data

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive​()
        Returns:
        true if accumulation is being performed in response to interval events.

      • setActive

        public final void setActive​(boolean active)
        Parameters:
        active - Sets whether accumulation is to be performed in response to interval events.

      • getPushInterval

        public final long getPushInterval​()
        Accumulated data are pushed to the data sinks after every pushInterval calls to putData. Default value is 1, meaning that accumulated Data is pushed every time putData is called.
        Returns:
        the current value of pushInterval.

      • setPushInterval

        public final void setPushInterval​(long i)
        Accumulated data are pushed to the data sinks after every pushInterval calls to putData. This method sets the pushInterval, and argument must be greater than zero. Default value is 1, meaning that every call to putData causes accumulator data to be pushed to its sink.
        Parameters:
        i - the pushInterval to be set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument is less than or equal to zero.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the output of dataInfo.getLabel() + " accumulator"
